intro: Hieracium sparsiramum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium sparsiramum is often found in open habitats and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
